WT_Merge_Control Class Reference

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Rendition attribute suggesting the rendering behavior of overlapping objects.

If it is set, the merge control indicates to a rendering application that a raster operation should to be performed on drawables in order to render the corresponding pixel colors, whenever the drawables overlap.

See also:
WT_Rendition

Suggested rendering of merged geometry

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum WT_Merge_Control::WT_Merge_Format
 

Merge operation to perform when objects overlap.

Enumerator:
Opaque  Overlapping geometry completely obscures underlying geometry.
Merge  Overlapping geometry pixel colors should mask merge (where the resultant pixel color is "mostly the top color.")
Transparent  Overlapping geometry pixel colors should exclusive-or.

Materializes the contents of the object from the file and the given opcode.

Reads in the object data and causes the file reading to proceed to the end of this object.

Warning:
This is used by the framework and should not be called by client code.
Return values:
WT_Result::Success The operation was successful.
WT_Result::Opcode_Not_Valid_For_This_Object The object does not support the opcode type.
WT_Result::Internal_Error Something went very wrong.

WT_Result WT_Merge_Control::skip_operand (  WT_Opcode const &  opcode,
WT_File &  file
)  [virtual]
 

Causes the file reading to proceed to the end of this object.

Warning:
This is used by the framework and should not be called by client code.
Bug:
Not all objects perform skip_operand() correctly; this is a known problem. For best results, if client code must use WT_File::get_next_object_shell() manually, it should also call the corresponding WT_Object::materialize() method to avoid this problem.
See also:
WT_File::get_next_object_shell(), WT_File_Heuristics::set_deferred_delete().

Reimplemented from WT_Object.
